result.execSummary:
One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Steven B Hause is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

(Clerked by RWinger)
Defendant Steven B Hause in court with attorney Kari Suzanne Hoel.  Angela Lynn Beranek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
THIS COVERS 15CF101, 15CF63, 15CF82 and 15CF327. 
15CF63: State moves to dismiss and read-in. Court grants. 
15CF82: Defendant pleads guilty to count 2. Court accepts the plea and finds the Defendant guilty. 
15CF101: Defendant pleads guilty to count 1. Court accepts the plea and finds the Defendant guilty.
15CF327:Defendant pleads guilty to counts 1 and 5. Court accepts the plea and finds the Defendant guilty. State moves to dismiss and read-in counts 3 and 4. Court grants. 
Felony admonitions given. Victims rights have been complied with. 

PSI ordered. Bond continues.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for December 15, 2015 at 09:30 am.
